meanings.definition: A person who follows or subscribes to the teachings or beliefs of another.
meanings.sent1: Many religious leaders have devoted followers who believe in their teachings.
meanings.sent2: She gained a new follower after giving an inspiring speech.
meanings.sent3: The followers of the famous chef eagerly awaited his new cookbook.
meanings.sent4: Her followers were like a flock of birds, always close behind her.
meanings.sent5: The followers of the fitness guru were dedicated to living a healthy lifestyle.

meanings.definition: A person who follows someone on social media.
meanings.sent1: I have many followers on my Instagram account who like my photos.
meanings.sent2: She became a popular influencer with thousands of followers on TikTok.
meanings.sent3: The young celebrity's followers eagerly awaited her next post.
meanings.sent4: Her followers on Twitter were like a virtual fan club.
meanings.sent5: The singer's followers on social media helped spread her music to a wider audience.

meanings.definition: A group of people who support or admire a particular person or cause.
meanings.sent1: The politician had a large group of loyal followers who attended all his rallies.
meanings.sent2: The environmental activist gained more followers for her cause after the protest.
meanings.sent3: The followers of the charity organization worked together to raise funds for a good cause.
meanings.sent4: Her followers in the community were like a strong support system for her.
meanings.sent5: The artist's followers showed up in large numbers to support her gallery opening.
